field_description.processed:
Virtual Workshop: Archery in Early China
Friday, Jan. 13 10:00-11:30 pm (Taipei/Beijing, UTC+8)

Presenters:

Rina Camus (Hong Kong Polytechnic University)
Archery: Context, Function, Significance

James Behuniak (Colby College)
Archery as Metaphor for Moral Agency

Susanne Adamski (Independent Scholar)
Archery as Reflected on Western Zhou Bronze Inscriptions

Chair and Discussant: Sarah Allan (Dartmouth College)


Please register by visiting https://pitt.zoom.us/j/96136369377 or 
scanning the QR code on the poster.

This workshop is part of the online colloquium series, "Philology in Our 
Time: The Early China Project Room." For further information, please 
visit our website https://philologyinourtime.org
